StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: NJ Methadone Maintenance Subject Recruitment for Genomic Analyses and Repository Expansion

Person.Organization: UNIV OF MED/DENT OF NJ-NJ MEDICAL SCHOOLRBHS-NEW JERSEY MEDICAL SCHOOL

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The suggested Acknowledgement Statement to accompany the dataset is: “Funding support for ‘NJ Methadone Maintenance Subject Recruitment for Genomic Analyses and Repository Expansion,’ which is a New Jersey extension of the Stanley H. Weiss Cohort Studies, was provided through an administrative supplement to ‘Harnessing Knowledge of Gene Function in Brain Tissue for Discovering Biology Underlying Heroin Addiction,’ NIDA grant 1R01DA044014-01, part of CFDA 93.279, Drug Abuse and Addiction Research Programs, PI Eric O. Johnson, PhD, of RTI International. The PI for the supplement through which these specimens and subject histories were collected is Stanley H. Weiss, MD, of Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences at Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey. The SNP genotyping data are supported by a contract from the National Institute on Drug Abuse for the support of the NIDA Genetics Consortium, of which Drs. Weiss and Johnson are members, and for which the current project officer is Jonathan D. Pollock, PhD.”

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (PUB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-PUB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical (IRB, PUB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: HMB-IRB-PUB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
